page.title: 05Torphichen Preceptory
page.content: Torphichen preceptory was the headquarters of the Knights of St. John in 12th century Scotland. The building is maintained by the ancient monuments division of the Scottish Development Agency and owned by Lord Torphichen. Set around the preceptory is a ring of sanctuary stones, these were positioned at - Westfield, Gormyre, Couston and Craigmailing. Of these only the one at Craigmailing no longer exists. A fair trial was something that was often lacking in medieval justice, however if a convicted criminal came within the ring of stones the knights would protect him until he was given a trial. On the upper floors of the building there is an exhibition on the history of the building and the Knights of St.John.
